page.title: 02HOUSING BRYNFORD
page.content: There are 60 houses in the avenue in Hafod y Bryn, Brynford. Most of these houses are semi-detached. Most have no garages. Some are made of stone and bricks. Some are bungalows and some are houses. There are no flats in Brynford and Pentre Halkyn.Some farms are built with local stone. There are alot of scattered houses in the area. Many houses are new and some are very old. Most of the houses in the village are council houses but the others are privately owned. Many of the council houses are centrally-heated by gas.A lot of the other houses have coal fires. The council houses have open plan gardens in the front of the house where the sheep make a mess!
